entry.title: Comment 1
entry.content: I don't know why you're bothering to update Torbutton at all. It completely disables Firefox, and is therefore completely worthless.

entry.title: Comment 2
entry.content: it disables anonymity attacks. if you're life and job depend on being anonymous, torbutton is fantastic. if you just want to browse privately, use relakks or anonymizer or some other thing to hide traffic.

entry.title: Comment 3
entry.content: downloaded the new version of tor 2.0.34. but it insists on asking for a password that i don't have. What do I do?

entry.title: Comment 5
entry.content:
Is there any chance of syncing TorButton and JonDoFox headers (user agent, etc.)?

Possible benefits:
* Tor users could choose whether they prefer to use TorButton or JonDoFox, but still get the same headers either way. JonDoFox already includes a Tor setting in its proxy switcher.
* JonDoFox is fully Firefox 3 compatible.
* The JonDos team does not change their settings very often, which makes it easier for a user of an alternate browser, such as Lynx or Konqueror, to attempt to duplicate the headers without constant maintenance.
* Collaboration on deciding what the optimum settings are.
* Anyone who uses both Tor and JonDo would be able to securely use the same settings for both - aside from the proxy setting, of course.
